lead_paragraph: A former grocery clerk must serve six months in federal prison for making bogus Internet postings warning of terrorist attacks against N.F.L. stadiums, a judge ruled Thursday. Jake Brahm must also serve six months under house arrest and repay $26,750 incurred in extra security costs at two of the stadiums. United States District Judge Jose L. Linares said Brahm, 22, conducted a “sick” hoax. Brahm, of Wauwatosa, Wis., entered a guilty plea in February.
